* Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL.
* Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


**Ansökan:**
 Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på mejl: johan@alsen@sogeti.se
   

  

 Genväg för snabb kontakt innan du ansöker? Självklart! Vi är bara två klick och ett micro-formulär bort. Första klicket
 **klicket här** 
 och du är igång.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: SecOps Engineer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a SecOps Engineer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a SecOps Engineer at Qred, you’ll be a part of the enabler team, supporting our compliance team and cross-functional teams, working in a modern technical stack. We don’t only talk about AWS, serverless and machine learning, we are heavily invested in it. You will advise, collaborate, code and break stuff. Your daily work will probably include the following:
   

  

* You’ll be ensuring strong security in all aspects of platform operations.
* Supporting product teams in their ability to build and secure cloud distributed systems, serverless architectures and container platforms.
* Supporting IT with client security configuration, alerting and response
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify the company needs and requirements and implement the best practices in house.
* Be awesome and hands-on with AWS, IaC, tooling and coding/scripting (python or nodejs).
* Work with product teams to help drive security projects.
* Coordinate any security related issue, both planned and unplanned.
* Security audits of our integrations
* Troubleshooting and support of anything that touches our security related systems for the entire company
* Be or want to be knowledgeable on relevant compliance with technical touchpoints for our industry, EBA ICT guidelines or DORA compliance as an example.


**Here’s what we're looking for:**
* A self-driven person with a flexible, positive mindset and strong team spirit, who loves helping others.
* You can write secure code in at least one language (we use Python and Typescript) and are familiar with secure coding practices (e.g., OWASP).
* You have a passion for breaking (and fixing) stuff. You see what others don’t.
* At least a few years of experience working with security and/or cloud ops.
* Solid work experience in AWS and security, preferably in serverless.
* You’ve worked in regulated, compliant environments.
* If you have an AWS certification (Developer, Solution Architect or Sysops) we’ll be extra interested!


**Why join us?**
 Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole cloud architecture, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid and flexible work setup, we do expect you to be in the office three days per week. Ideally, the role would be filled as soon as possible, but we’re happy to agree on a mutually suitable start date for the right candidate.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: MuleSoft Integration Developer
description:
At
 **Schibsted** 
 , our mission is to empower people in the Nordics to make informed decisions through high-quality journalism and innovative digital solutions. Behind the scenes, our Integration Solutions team ensures that systems and services are seamlessly connected, enabling efficient workflows and operations across the organization.
   

  

 We are currently seeking an
 **Integration Developer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **MuleSoft Anypoint** 
 . Ideally, you also bring experience in platform and infrastructure management to support our growing
 **Integration Solutions team** 
 . If you're passionate about building scalable integration systems, automating infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, open-minded team, this could be your next exciting challenge.
   

  

 In this role, your main responsibility will be integration development within MuleSoft. Additionally, you will also work with infrastructure management. You will be a key member of the development team, as well as collaborate closely with the infrastructure team to manage the platform infrastructure, ensuring seamless system integration and robust infrastructure management. You will ensure that the different components of the integration platform (logging, monitoring, deployment etc) work seamlessly together in a unified manner.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
 With Schibsted transitioning into two distinct companies,
 **Schibsted** 
 and
 **Vend** 
 , our Integration Solutions team is playing a key role in building a future-ready integration landscape. We’re establishing a new
 **Integration Competency Center (ICC)** 
 to support this transformation, and you’ll be part of shaping the tools, processes, and infrastructure that support essential business operations across HR, Finance, Payroll, and more.
   

  

**What you’ll do**
 As an
 **Integration Developer** 
 focused on platform and infrastructure, you will:
   

  

* Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and secure integration solutions using Mulesoft.
* Monitor and maintain platform performance with proactive incident and environment management.
* Collaborate with both IT and business stakeholders to translate needs into practical, scalable solutions.
* Work closely with Solution Architects and Integration Architects to continuously evolve our integration platform.
* Actively contribute to a transparent, agile team environment, sharing responsibilities like the Scrum Master role.


**Who you are**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and values honest collaboration. You might be a great match if you:
   

  

* Are passionate about technology and creating well-functioning, scalable integration solutions.
* Drive integrations from concept to production with a focus on automation, scalability, and continuous improvement.
* A strong communicator who can explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
* Are pragmatic, proactive, and always looking for opportunities to improve tools and processes.
* Enjoy working closely with others and helping build a collaborative team culture.
* Embrace feedback and continuous learning as part of your daily work.


**What you bring**
 We're looking for a strong mix of technical skills and collaborative mindset. Ideally, you have:
   

  

* Hands-on experience designing and implementing integration solutions using tools like MuleSoft, APIs, and event-driven messaging.
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools (like GitHub Actions) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform) is helpful, especially when collaborating with the infra team, but not essential.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for creating maintainable, high-quality solutions.
* The ability to work independently while contributing actively to an agile, team-driven environment.

title: Senior Backend Kotlin Engineer
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Backend Engineer with proficiency in Kotlin, preferably combined with Ktor or a similar asynchronous backend framework. The candidate will become an integral part of our team working with sustainable consumer products and payments globally. You will be contributing to a large-scale, multi-regional commerce platform serving millions of consumers worldwide.
   

  

 Furthermore, the role comes with end-to-end autonomy in application design, with a high degree of influence over architecture and implementation of the microservices being built, combined with full responsibility and ownership for their quality, scalability, deployment and lifecycle. The perfect candidate is a passionate developer who has worked with multi-regional backends where multiple platform installations run across multiple clusters, time zones, and datacenters worldwide.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
* A high degree of autonomy in developing new services.
* Freedom to design and shape service architecture.
* Being part of a dedicated team that values collaboration and strong engineering practices.
* Development of new capabilities on a modern, well-maintained platform with careful management of technical debt.
* Excellent benefits for future parental leave.
* A generous vacation allowance of 40 days per year.
* A flexible working environment with a well-situated office in central Stockholm


**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain robust and scalable backend services primarily using Kotlin and Ktor.
* Engage in architectural discussions and contribute to the design of a multi-regional backend.
* Maintain and manage SQL and NoSQL databases.
* Integrate with search clusters such as OpenSearch.
* Work on our payment & product platform and ensure fault tolerance.
* Manage deployments with tools like Github, Gradle & CircleCI.
* Monitor built services directly in cluster and through services such as Sentry and Datadog.
* Mentor junior engineers, guiding them on best practices.


**Required Qualifications:**
* 7+ years of professional backend engineering experience.
* 3+ years of developing in Kotlin, with extensive understanding of modern and asynchronous backend frameworks.
* Worked with Kafka or a similar event streaming platform
* Fluent in git, CI/CD and build automation.
* Knowledge of how to deploy, ingress, monitor and manage backend services in a Kubernetes cluster.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience working with Ktor in a large-scale production environment is a major qualifier.
* Hands-on experience and understanding of payment platforms is advantageous.
* Familiarity with AWS and infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform/Terragrunt.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden)
   

  

**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

title: Lead Data Engineer / Snowflake Lead Developer
description:
**Job ID: 26981**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 Would you like to be a lead and front runner of Data & Reporting development of Snowflake solutions – building best practice solutions based on Kafka, API’s and implement the newest Nordea Data Reference Architecture? Your technical expertise will include general software engineering, Data Warehouse, as well as big data/streaming analytics.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 You will work closely together with business product owners and IT Analysts, business SME’s, Group Architecture and other developers to understand and analyse the business needs from which you will design and implement end-2-end solutions on our new Snowflake platform. And ensuring that consumers easily can translate data to insight and business value.
   

  

 You’ll join Data and Reporting, where we are delivering the future Data & Analytics platforms and solutions for Nordea Transaction Banking. We deliver on multiple data platforms (Snowflake, Power BI and Confluence Kafka), as well as on many enterprise and self-service data integration & analytical platforms.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Handson development and solution design
* End2end design
* Data Streaming/data integration
* Data storage on Snowflake
* Data modelling including monitoring of Data Quality
* ELT: dbt / Python / Others
* Technical coaching and sharing best practices for the development team(s) based in Denmark, Poland and India:
* Solution design and data modelling
* Recommendations about platform/tool selections, information architecture, including implementation of data governance principles
* Focusing on business requirements and understanding of the complete Data & analytics delivery value chain:
* Analysing requirement and define overall implementation standards together with architects and developers
* Data analysis & modelling
* Proactively engaging stakeholders
* Validating the solutions both from a requirement fulfilment perspective, as well as from a technical perspective (fit for purpose)


 The role is based in Copenhagen (DK), Stockholm (SE) or Helsinki (FI).
   

  

**Who You Are**
**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**
* Work well with others and always act with the customer’s needs in mind
* Love learning and trying new things
* Are honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult and committed to empowering others
* Are passionate about doing a great job


**Your experience and background:**
* 8+ years’ experience in DW, BI & analytics as an architect and/or developer
* Data related programming skills (Java/Scala)
* Academic IT degree
* Great communicator with business and be a bridge builder between business and IT
* English language skills


**Technical skills:**
* Kafka (Kafka connect / producers and consumers)
* Hands on experience with building e2e data pipelines on Snowflake/AWS (dbt, etc.)
* SnowCLI / SnowPark
* Java and building APIs
* Knowledge about Apache Iceberg


**It is beneficial if you know/have:**
* DataStage
* Power BI
* MSSQL -SSIS / SSAS
* Oracle RDBM
* Experience with information and/or solution architecture is preferred


**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**People** 
 are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than [cust\_PostEnd]. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare inom Java
description:
**Senior Fullstackutvecklare inom Java till Accelerate at Iver!**
 Vill du ta din expertis inom fullstackutveckling till nästa nivå? Vi söker en skicklig utvecklare med lång erfarenhet av Java och moderna frontend-ramverk som vill vara med och bygga framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med oss på Accelerate at Iver.
   

  

**Varför Accelerate at Iver?**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett uppdrag – vi erbjuder en plattform för att växa som expert inom modern mjukvaruutveckling! Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med spännande teknik och kunder – du blir en del av ett värderingsdrivet, passionerat team där du får stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och inflytande.
   

  

**Som Konsult Hos Oss Får Du**
 🎯 En skräddarsydd utvecklings- och certifieringsplan
   

  

 🚀 Utmanande och varierande kunduppdrag med den senaste tekniken
   

  

 🕊️ Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
   

  

 🛡️ En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner och kollektivavtal
   

  

 🤜🤛 Ett sammansvetsat team av vassa specialister som lyfter varandra
   

  

 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i teknisk framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior fullstackutvecklare inom Java hos oss är du en nyckelspelare i att utveckla stabila, moderna och skalbara applikationer. Du bidrar med både teknisk erfarenhet och ett agilt mindset i projekt som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Du arbetar både med backendlogik i Java och Spring Boot, och med moderna frontendramverk som React och Angular. Du jobbar nära DevOps och är bekväm med CI/CD, containerisering och molnmiljöer.
   

  

**Exempel på vad du kommer att göra i ditt konsultuppdrag:**
* Utveckla och underhålla mikrotjänstbaserade backendlösningar i Java/Spring Boot
* Skapa intuitiva och responsiva användargränssnitt med React, Angular eller liknande.
* Arbeta med databaser som MySQL och Oracle DB
* Bygga och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för automatisk testning och leverans
* Arbeta med Docker och Kubernetes för containerhantering och orkestrering
* Delta i arkitektur- och designbeslut samt mentorera juniora kollegor


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 8 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, med djup kompetens inom Java och erfarenhet av moderna webbteknologier. Du är lösningsorienterad, gillar att jobba nära verksamheten och har ett öga för både teknik och användarvärde. Du har en akademisk utbildning med inriktning mot systemutveckling, webbutveckling eller liknande.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat
   

  

**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av några av följande:**
* Java, Spring Boot
* TypeScript/JavaScript
* React, Angular eller liknande
* MySQL, Oracle DB
* CI/CD-verktyg
* Docker och Kubernetes


**Extra Plus Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och TDD
* Certifieringar inom Java eller molnplattformar
* Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur eller teknisk ledarroll


**Placeringsort**
 📍 Accelerate at Iver finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Solna, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 👉 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!** 
 🚀

title: Testingenjör inbyggda system
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ge dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 På Getinge Critical Care i Solna utvecklas och tillverkas ventilatorer och anestesimaskiner till sjukvården. Vi söker nu en testare till ett av våra R&D team inom anestesi.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av 8 personer och ansvarar för Core SW, systemarkitektur, cyber security samt connectivity i våra anestesimaskiner. Din roll i detta team och inom anestesi är att testa Core SW tillsammans med lågnivå SW för att säkerställa kvaliteten på mjukvaran i våra maskiner.
   

  

 Inom R&D arbetar vi i tvärfunktionella team med såväl juniora som seniora ingenjörer inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Testa delsystems SW kopplat till Core och lågnivå
* Testa uppkopplade system och systemintegritet såsom connectivity och cyber security
* Inför releaser och formativa tester ingå i ett större testteam för att validera och verifiera system SW
* Skriva testspecifikationer/testfall samt exekvera/rapportera både för manuella och automatiska tester
* Dokumentation i våra kvalitetssystem
* Ett nära samarbete med systemarkitekt, SW-utvecklare och övrig testorganisation inom anestesi
* Delaktig i test och verifiering av framtidens generation samt den befintliga versionen av vår anestesimaskin
* Du kommer att arbeta på plats i våra nyrenoverade lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta på distans någon dag i veckan.


**Vad du har med dig**
 I den här rollen ser vi att du har följande med dig:
   

  

* Civil- eller Högskoleingenjörsexamen
* Några års erfarenhet inom manuella tester av inbyggda system.
* Goda kunskaper i något av språken eller ramverken kring C++/Python/Squish
* Erfarenhet av att testa inbyggda system
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Linux och ett intresse för CI/CD.
* Erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och test.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom medicinteknik.
* Erfarenhet av mätteknik kopplat till flöde, tryck, spänning etc.


 Förutom tekniska färdigheter värderar vi din personlighet högt. Som person tror vi att du är driven, nyfiken, engagerad samt positiv till nya idéer och arbetssätt Du är självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ. Du är van och trivs med att kommunicera med olika intressenter i en organisation tillika att samarbeta både i och utanför teamet. Vi tror att du har lätt för att lära dig nya tekniska områden och att du är bekväm i att fatta tekniska beslut.
   

  

 På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och sätter stort värde på kvalitet och samarbete. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra för att vi som team och bolag ska kunna fortsatta utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner och gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt detta för att säkerställa att vi stöder ditt välbefinnande och dina mål.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett jobb i en säker och informell arbetsmiljö, där vi uppskattar en positiv inställning och ett nära teamsamarbete. Vi har en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare, samt mellan teamen. Vi fokuserar på att utveckla människor och tillsammans skapar vi en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling när du börjar din karriär hos oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Katarina Dahlén på katarina.dahlen@getinge.com eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand på sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vi hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade medicintekniska företag.

title: Projektchef Hus Stockholm
description:
**Tjänsten som Projektchef**
 Vill du leda några av Stockholms mest spännande byggprojekt tillsammans med engagerade och stöttande kollegor? Vi söker dig som vill ta ett tydligt ledaransvar och samtidigt bidra till en trygg, utvecklande och hållbar arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du vara med och forma projekt som gör skillnad – från tunnelbanestation i Hagastaden till simhall i Haninge.
   

  

 Som Projektchef hos oss har du resultatansvar för ett eller flera projekt. Du får ett övergripande ansvar för att genomföra projekten från start till mål inom bestämda tids-, kvalitets- och kostnadsramar och säkerställer att kundens förväntningar uppfylls. I din roll driver och leder du planerings- och produktionsprocessen tillsammans med övriga medarbetare i projektet och ser till att arbetet genomförs i överensstämmelse med NCC:s värderingar – ärlighet, tillit, respekt.
   

  

 Du förväntas fokusera på dina medarbetares utveckling, där du coachar och motiverar dem till att nå både personliga och gemensamma mål genom att tydliggöra förväntningar och kontinuerligt ge feedback.
   

  

 En viktig del i rollen är att medverka i projektens tidiga skeden. Här ansvarar du för att involvera berörda medarbetare för att tillsammans med dem definiera produkt och produktionsmetod, i syfte att skapa rätt förutsättningar för god arbetsmiljö, framdrift och ekonomi i projektet.
   

  

 Som Projektchef hos oss interagerar du med olika funktioner och grupperingar både inom företaget och externt, något som ställer krav på god kommunikationsförmåga. Att samverka med övriga medarbetare i projekten är en nyckelfråga för vår framgångsrika verksamhet och det är av största vikt att du brinner för att skapa ett nära samarbete med avdelningens affärs- och specialistorganisation.
   

  

 Vill du jobba i ett företag med god projektkultur, goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och ha bra balans mellan arbete och fritid? Då kommer du att trivas hos oss!
   

  

**Om avdelning Hus Stockholm**
 På avdelning Hus Stockholm inom NCC Building Sweden arbetar vi med ny- och ombyggnation av exempelvis skolor, kontor, sjukhus och infrastrukturbyggnader. Vi är ett engagerat team som samarbetar för att driva utveckling framåt med fokus på hållbarhet, teknik, mångfald och gemenskap. Våra projekt är ofta stora, komplexa och drivs i samverkan från tidigt skede – många i samarbete med vår interna utvecklare NCC Property Development. Vårt mål är att vara en förebild i branschen och en riktigt bra arbetsplats.
   

  

**Din profil som Projektchef**
 Du har god erfarenhet av byggbranschen och har arbetat som Projektchef eller i en liknande roll i ett antal år. Det är meriterande med en teknisk utbildning.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har en god samordningsförmåga samt leder och uppmärksammar dina medarbetares färdigheter med målsättningen att få till ett effektivt och välfungerande team. Du trivs i nära samarbete med dina kollegor och arbetar aktivt efter att bygga en gemenskap i gruppen, men har även förmågan att skapa ett driv och en vinnarkänsla.
   

  

 Som person är du affärsmässig, positiv och strukturerad. Du kan identifiera och analysera risker men motiveras framförallt av att finna lösningar på de utmaningar du ställs inför. Du är nyfiken på att själv utvecklas. Att säkra bra leveranser är viktigt för dig och du söker efter utvecklingsmöjligheter i arbetssätt och metoder för att nå bättre lösningar.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas på dina personliga egenskaper och din förmåga att samarbeta och utveckla medarbetare.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten utför vi bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidater i enlighet med NCC:s säkerhetskultur.
   

  

**NCC erbjuder**
 Vi på NCC vill vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare med medarbetare som trivs, utvecklas och mår bra. Därför erbjuder vi dig som arbetar hos oss ett stort utbud av personalförmåner. NCC har kollektivavtal för alla medarbetare. Det ger en bra grundtrygghet och ett tydligt regelverk så att du vet vad som gäller för din anställning. Vi erbjuder också försäkringar, arbetstidsförkortning, friskvårdsbidrag samt andra erbjudanden och rabatter via vår förmånsportal Benify.
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 Välkommen att kontakta Fredrik Bergendahl, Produktionschef på
   

  

 fredrik.bergendahl@ncc eller Irene Knutar, Produktionschef på irene.knutar@ncc.se
   

  

 Registrera din ansökan och CV nedan. Urval och tillsättning sker löpande, ansök därför så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2025-08-15.
   

  

*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*
 Vi undanber oss vänligen kontakt med rekryterare samt säljare av annons- eller bemanningslösningar.
   

  

**Bygg med oss och få branschens bästa kollegor**
 På NCC drivs vi av att fortsätta utvecklas, oavsett om det handlar om våra byggprojekt eller vår personliga kompetens. Varje dag driver vi branschens mest spännande och komplexa byggprojekt framåt i ett nära samarbete mellan våra medarbetare, samarbetsparters och kunder. Hos oss är du en betydelsefull medarbetare som bidrar till de landmärken som definierar våra städer och samhällen. Här tar våra medarbetare en aktiv roll i en företagskultur grundad på stabila värderingar och beteenden för en trygg och säker arbetsplats. Vår samlade kompetens och varierande bakgrund gör skillnad.
   

  

**NCC - ett av de ledande företagen i Norden**

title: Senior product designer (Venture Partner)
description:
#### **The opportunity**


At VNTRS, we don't just consult, we invest our expertise as a hands-on partner. We're a venture studio that partners with tech entrepreneurs to turn great ideas into game-changing companies.


We're looking for a design leader who believes that world-class design is the cornerstone of product strategy. This isn't just about creating elegant interfaces; it's about making the critical design decisions that shape a company's trajectory. You'll often be the design lead for our portfolio companies, translating ambiguous founder visions into tangible, user-loved digital products.

#### **The role: a strategic design expert**


As a senior product designer at VNTRS, you are the champion of both the user and the business. Your primary craft is design, but your canvas is the entire product. We're looking for a “pi-shaped” designer with deep expertise in both UX and UI, who also has a broad understanding of branding, strategy, and technology.


You will lead the design effort from concept to launch, while also serving as a strategic advisor to founders. In our context, the designer is often the bridge that holds a project together, acting as a product strategist and leader. You'll need to be both a safe, mentoring guide for our partners and a skilled craftsperson who can take an idea from a sketch to a fully realized design, ready for development, in just a few weeks.

#### **How you'll make an impact**

**Lead the end-to-end design vision.** You'll own the entire design process, from workshops and user research to creating high-fidelity prototypes and scalable design systems. You are the hands-on expert responsible for the product's look, feel, and user experience.

**Translate ambiguity into clarity.** You'll work directly with founders and stakeholders to de-risk ideas, validate concepts with users, and chart a clear path from idea to a shippable MVP.

**Partner on product strategy.** While you won't always own the backlog, you'll be a critical voice in shaping it. You'll use design thinking and user insights to influence the roadmap and help the team prioritize what truly matters.

**Elevate the craft.** You'll be the expert on interaction design, visual identity, and user research, with a particular strength in UI design. You'll work closely with developers to ensure pixel-perfect execution and iterate on the design as it comes to life in code.

**Mentor and guide founders.** You'll act as the design expert in the room, facilitating workshops, managing expectations, and guiding founders to make informed decisions for their brand and product.


#### **Who you are**

**You have a rich portfolio** that showcases your expertise in building digital products, demonstrating excellence in both UX and UI.

**You have 6+ years of experience as a product designer and/or project manager**, having worked across different industries with both large and small companies. Experience from a leading digital consultancy or agency is a major plus.

**You have a strong understanding of branding** and have experience creating visual identities, design guidelines, or design systems (logos, colors, typography, etc.).

**You see design as a function that drives business outcomes**, not just an aesthetic layer.

**You're an expert with modern design tools like Figma and Framer**, using them to deliver high-quality work efficiently

**You actively explore how to use AI in your workflow**, and having experience or a strong interest in designing AI-powered products is a major plus.

**You are a pragmatic designer** who understands that in a startup environment, process must sometimes be adapted to deliver value quickly.

**You have exceptional communication and presentation skills**, capable of articulating design decisions and inspiring confidence in founders and engineers.

**You are fluent in both Swedish and English**.


#### **Why VNTRS?**


Our culture is built on being caring, adventurous, and inspiring. You'll join a passionate team that encourages an entrepreneurial spirit and shares in the rewards of our work through a shared investment fund of tech startups.

**Invest in a growing portfolio of startups.** Become a part-owner in the companies you help build. Our unique model grants you equity in our investment fund, so you share directly in the success you create.

**Have real autonomy and impact.** You're not just a cog in a machine. You are the product and design authority for your projects, with the responsibility and freedom that comes with that.

**Tackle diverse challenges.** One day you might be building a fintech platform, the next a medtech app. The variety of our portfolio means you're always learning and growing.

**Great work-life balance.** We're a tightly-knit team of adventurers and creators. We succeed together, with social events, shared lunches, and a genuine focus on a great work-life balance.

title: Vi söker en UX-designer och strateg som kan leda och inspirera
description:
Vi tror att framgångsrikt UX-arbete kräver både nyfikenhet och mod. Du är orädd, vågar utmana och har tålamodet att steg för steg leda kund och team mot bättre upplevelser.  

Du sätter riktning, håller ihop processen och ser till att användarperspektivet alltid finns med.  

  



Du har förmågan att se helheten och lyfta både användarupplevelsen och affären genom att identifiera förbättringsområden, utmana befintliga lösningar och bidra med konkreta förslag. Genom att facilitera workshops, genomföra analyser och leda diskussioner omsätter du insikter till strategiska beslut och tar, tillsammans med teamet, fram lösningar som gör skillnad.

  

Du är en energigivande kraft som engagerar, stöttar och leder tryggt genom komplexa processer även när vägen är krokig. I samarbeten är du prestigelös, delar generöst med dig av din kunskap, bollar idéer och vet när det är läge att driva på eller backa. Eftersom vi ofta arbetar långsiktigt är du också skicklig på att bygga och vårda starka relationer.

  

Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden, ofta på plats hos dem, där du blir en naturlig partner i deras dagliga verksamhet tillsammans med teamet från KAN. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift, på professionell nivå.


Vi söker dig som vill vara med och vidareutveckla och ta vårt UX-erbjudande till nästa nivå. Som UX-designer kommer du att spela en central roll i vårt arbete med att förbättra och utveckla användarupplevelsen i våra kunders digitala lösningar.  

  



### **Rollen innebär bland annat:**

* Leda workshops tillsammans med kund och team för att förstå verksamhetens mål och användarnas behov.
* Dokumentera krav och formulera lösningar, exempelvis genom wireframes och prototyper.
* Ta fram och förbättra informationsarkitektur och användarflöden på webbplatser och i digitala tjänster.
* Genomföra User Research – såsom intervjuer, användartester eller enkäter – och analysera resultaten.
* Identifiera förbättringsområden och presentera förslag som stärker både affär och användarupplevelse.
* Följa upp, mäta och analysera resultat för att säkerställa att arbetet driver mot uppsatta mål och önskad effekt.
* Arbeta nära utvecklare, analytiker, projektledare, designers och kund för att säkerställa en förstklassig användarupplevelse vid lansering.
* Säkerställa tillgänglighet enligt WCAG och andra relevanta riktlinjer och bygga lösningar som fungerar för alla användare.
* Arbeta agilt i sprintar och använda verktyg som Figma, Jira och andra molnbaserade plattformar för att driva arbetet framåt.
* Bidra till att utveckla och förvalta designsystem som skapar enhetliga och skalbara lösningar över tid.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Om Dentme – tandvård som den borde vara**


Dentme är den första privata aktören i Sverige som erbjuder tandvård på abonnemang – helt utan bindningstider. Vi bygger framtidens tandvård, där patientens hälsa och upplevelse alltid står i centrum. Vår enkla prismodell gör det möjligt för tandläkare att fokusera på högsta vårdkvalitet utan ekonomiska incitament som styr arbetet. Resultatet är nöjdare patienter och en hållbar affärsmodell för alla inblandade.


Sedan lanseringen har vi vuxit till över **7 000 betalande medlemmar**, och resan har bara börjat. Med **150 miljoner kronor i färsk riskkapitalfinansiering**, uppmärksammat av Dagens Industri, är vi väl rustade att växa snabbt och ta tandvården in i en ny era – både digitalt och på våra kliniker.

 **Rollen**


Det här är en unik möjlighet – du blir Dentmes **första Product Manager**. Rollen kombinerar det som ofta kallas *produktägare* (ansvar för backlog, prioritering och nära samarbete med utvecklingsteamet) med det bredare ansvaret för att utveckla Dentmes digitala patientupplevelse och driva vår produktstrategi framåt.


Du får helhetsansvar för vår digitala produktutveckling. Det innebär att du blir navet mellan affär, klinik och utveckling – med mandat att forma både arbetssätt, processer och kultur.

 **Vad du kommer göra**

* Äga och utveckla Dentmes digitala patientresa – från första besök på hemsidan till bokning, behandling och uppföljning.
* Ansvara för backlog och roadmap: prioritera, planera och bryta ner arbetet tillsammans med utvecklare och UX.
* Identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter och driva experiment (A/B-tester, funnel-optimering, hypotesdrivet arbete).
* Samla insikter från patienter, klinikpersonal, marknad och affärssidan – och översätta dem till lösningar som gör skillnad.
* Säkerställa att våra digitala lösningar möter regulatoriska krav (t.ex. GDPR, Patientdatalagen) utan att kompromissa med användarupplevelsen.
* Jobba tvärfunktionellt tillsammans med utveckling, UX, marknad och klinikorganisationen.
  

**Vem vi söker**


Vi tror att du:

* Har **3–5 års erfarenhet** av produktledning, produktägarskap eller liknande roller.
* Har tidigare erfarenhet som **produktägare**, eller arbetat så nära en produktägare att du har en djup förståelse för rollen.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en **digital produktmiljö** – gärna SaaS, konsumenttjänster eller annan reglerad verksamhet.
* Är van att jobba **datadrivet** och har testat att driva hypoteser, funnel-optimering eller A/B-tester.
* Har en **naturlig känsla för användarupplevelser** och kan översätta behov till lösningar tillsammans med UX och utvecklare.
* Är en stark **kommunikatör** som kan skapa tydlighet och engagemang både i teamet och med övriga organisationen.


Extra plus om du:

* Har erfarenhet från **startup/scaleup-miljö**.
* Har arbetat i en **reglerad verksamhet** (t.ex. vård, bank eller försäkring).
* Är bekant med verktyg som **Jira eller Linear**.
  

**Varför Dentme?**

* Möjligheten att vara med från början och bygga en produktorganisation som på riktigt förändrar en hel bransch.
* Snabbväxande startup med stark finansiering (vi tog nyligen in 150 MSEK i riskkapital).
* Ett bolag med en tydlig mission: bättre tandvård för fler, utan stress och krångliga prismodeller.
* Ett team i uppbyggnadsfas där du får stort inflytande på arbetssätt, verktyg och kultur.
  

**Ansökan**


Låter det här som nästa steg för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi intervjuar löpande.


Välkommen till Dentme – där vi tillsammans bygger framtidens tandvård.

title: UX Designer
description:
By Marcus Bengtsson
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a fully remote and close team of ambitious friends spread out over the world to help consumers connect with great brands and products. Checkin.com is already providing the best registration flows in the world, working with some of the coolest and most innovative global partners, brands and suppliers to evolve every day.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our Product Team is world leading in the area of data driven design and personalization. Be part of challenging the way things have been designed years ago where poorly designed user experiences are being accepted as the truth. As a UX Designer at Checkin.com you will get the opportunity to grow and apply your skills widely and deeply. What you create will be reviewed together with some of the World's largest companies with a shared love for simplicity, design and an obsession for making practical and innovative user experiences. Your output will affect online users within days from first sketch to facing millions of users around the globe.
   

  

**About You**
 You are ambitious, responsible and curious with genuine love for product and UX. You want to continue your career in a fast paced startup instead of seeing your vision getting stuck while fighting backlog wars in slow moving organizations. Your location does obviously not matter since we are a remote team. Don’t forget to include your portfolio and a few words why you want to be a part of our journey.
   

  

 Interested?
   

  

 Send an email to join@checkin.com explaining why you would be a good fit to the team and we will review and get back to setup a short video call to get to know you a bit better

title: Creative Intern
company_industry: Broadcast Media Production and Distribution, Social Networking Platforms, and Media Production
description:
**✨ Creative Intern — Storytelling, UX, and Visual Design - Praktik** 




  





*Are you a passionate UX or design talent, a distinctive website builder, a visual thinker, or a media creator with a Nordic soul and a sharp creative eye? Do you blend cinematic intuition with AI-native tools like Runway, ElevenLabs, and ChatGPT — turning deep ideas into bold, visually intelligent narratives that move brands and audiences alike?* 




  





 We’re looking for a creative intern to join Freja North Studios — a newly launched, boutique Scandinavian creative house focused on visual storytelling, web design, media, and feminine brand building.
 



  





**🌿 About Us** 




  





**Freja North Studios** 
 is a multidisciplinary creative studio built for a new generation of thinkers and makers. We create beautiful, intelligent experiences across
 **branding, design, writing, UX, and short-form media** 
 , blending myth, emotion, and minimalism into everything we touch.
 



  





 Founded by the creators of
 **Swiss Finance Academy** 
 and
 **Britannica Capital** 
 , our studio operates at the intersection of
 **creativity, education, and entrepreneurship** 
 , with a strong international and digital presence.
 



  





**✨ What You’ll Do** 




  




* Assist with visual and UX design for websites and brand touchpoints.
* Collaborate on short-form storytelling and content (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn, Notion, YouTube shorts, Substack).
* Support story development, campaign ideas, and narrative voice.
* Contribute to moodboards, user journeys, or simple Figma flows.
* Learn to work in an aesthetic-driven, feedback-rich, fast-moving environment.



  





**🌸 This Role Is For You If You:** 




  




* Are based in Sweden (or Nordic-adjacent) and fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Love beautiful, thoughtful design, storytelling, and emotionally intelligent brands.
* Have an eye for detail and care about visuals, spacing, tone, and mood.
* Want to work in a small, independent, values-driven team where your ideas matter.
* Are comfortable with uncertainty, feedback, and growing fast.



  





**🌿** 
 Bonus If You:
 



  




* Have experience with Wix, Runway, Google Veo 3, Flow, Figma, Webflow, Canva, or Notion.
* Enjoy writing or have experience in brand voice, social captions, or content design.
* Are familiar with Scandinavian or feminine aesthetics, branding, or visual storytelling.



  





 🕊 What We Offer:
 



  




* Flexible hours (part-time / remote hybrid).
* A creative studio that prioritizes depth, quality, and emotional clarity over corporate buzzwords.
* Close mentorship from a founder with deep entrepreneurial and creative expertise.
* Potential to grow into a larger role in branding, content, or design leadership.



  





 We’re the Stockholm-based creative arm of a global fund with roots in New York, now shaping a new kind of brand voice — one that speaks through cinematic storytelling, immersive visuals, and intuitive design, not just pitch decks and PDFs. This is your opportunity to help craft a 60–90 second short film capturing a founder’s journey through over 100 countries, bring global macro insights to life through animated research, elevate our web presence, and build a visual identity with clarity, emotion, and bold creative direction.
 



  





 Ideal for candidates with experience in video production, social media, website design, CMS, animations, brand creation, story-telling and AI tools for social presence.
 



  





 This is not
 *just* 
 a Canva project. This is your chance to create a visual story that conveys gravitas, edge, and global strategic intelligence.
 



  





**🌿** 
 What you will also get to contribute to:
 



  




* Improving and enhancing websites including mobile versions.
* Creating CMS and other dynamic content.
* Improving design for direct email and investor newsletters.
* Leveraging tools like Runway, Pika Labs, ChatGPT, and ElevenLabs to storyboard, animate, voice, and fine-tune the final deliverable.
* Working directly with the founder — a globally traveled Wall Street pro and builder — to refine message, tone, and visual intensity.
* Ensuring all output feels institutional-grade, not templated or commercial.
* Designing and producing short-form documentary teasers that presents a hedge fund story like no other — combining finance, geopolitical depth, and frontier-building narrative.



  





  





**🌸** 
 You should have:
 



  




* Strong visual taste and creative judgment (this is more “Vice docu-meets-Wall Street elite” than startup explainer video).
* Experience (or fast-learning capability) with AI video tools like Runway or Pika, plus voice tools like ElevenLabs.
* Ability to use ChatGPT to prototype scripts or narratives, then refine beyond the generic.
* High self-direction and brutal attention to detail — this is a serious deliverable.
* Communication and Marketing skills
* Video Production and Photography skills
* Wix, Mailchimp and CMS skills.



  





 Internship Details:
 



  




* Hybrid but based in Stockholm
* Can be part time or full time
* Unpaid. This is Swedish
 **Praktik** 
 : This has an educational and professional development component so it is unpaid.
* Tailored for those ready to step beyond the academic and into the world of real storytelling.
* Our company's or affiliates locations include New York, Connecticut, London, Zurich and Stockholm.



  





 Portfolio submission encouraged

title: Acne Studios Junior Digital Designer
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone's contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Junior Digital Designer at our Stockholm HQ you will play a pivotal role in the rapid, creative and commercial expansion of our online store acnestudios.com. Digital Design plays an important part of Acne Studios' ambition of being at the forefront of luxury E-Commerce. In this position you will have a key role in the day-to-day enhancement of our online store, ensuring the input from the Creative Director and business stakeholders is implemented within agreed deadlines.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with exceptional attention to detail, a creative problem-solver and a team player with a keen interest in design, fashion and technology. The position will be based at Acne Studios' headquarters in Stockholm and reports to the Head of Digital Studio.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design innovative and engaging visuals for our digital platforms, including acnestudios.com, social media campaigns, newsletters, collaborations, and more.
* Solve complex visual challenges while upholding the aesthetic integrity of the Acne Studios brand.
* Collaborate with UX designers, art directors, front-end developers, merchandisers, content publishers, and the marketing team.
* Maintain design consistency across all digital channels, ensuring alignment with the brand's creative direction.
* Stay ahead of emerging trends in digital design, fashion, and technology to keep our digital presence at the cutting edge.


**Who You Are**
 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Specific Personal Qualities For This Role**
* A strong eye for design with an understanding of front-end implementation, particularly in an E-commerce context.
* A collaborative mindset with a proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving.
* The ability to remain calm and focused under pressure, managing tight deadlines without compromising on quality.


**Specific Experience And Knowledge For This Role**
* Around two years of experience in digital or web design
* Proficiency in Figma
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* An online portfolio showcasing your previous work


**Please attach a portfolio showcasing relevant work as part of your application.**
 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: UI/UX Designer - Games
description:
As a UI/UX Designer you will be working on one of our Game Projects together with other designers, artists and engineers.
   

  

 The role requires taking ownership for UX/UI design of game features and driving initiatives within those to improve the end-user experience. You are expected to drive design work end-to-end for features while working closely in a cross-disciplinary team.
   

  

 You will be part of designing and shipping new features for live service products, while balancing maintenance of existing features. Experience working with design for multiple platforms and input methods such as PC, console or mobile, is a plus.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in cross-disciplinary teams and align stakeholders around design decisions to ensure shared understanding and designs.
* Create designs using user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes, that adhere to design systems and style guides.
* Work proactively, identifying gaps in the user experience to inform improvements
* You don’t think of just screens, you think in systems. Consider edge cases early on, flexible design solutions, and drive consistency with creativity.
* Help leveling-up UX understanding and skills at Embark, drive the discipline forward in the studio.
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team, to leverage the team’s combined expertise in finding the best solutions.


**We would love if you have**
* A portfolio showcasing a couple of relevant projects from previous work.
* 5+ years of experience within UX/UI or product design, or similar.
* Experience working data-driven to inform design decisions.
* Experience working with live service cross-platform products
* Systematic approach to design.
* A creative and curious mind with a passion for user-centered design
* An interest in games!
* Fluency in English


*For this role we are only considering candidates already residing in Sweden.*
 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Product Manager - Customer Solutions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Product Manager on our Customer Solutions team, you'll drive product strategy at the intersection of customer experience and business growth. This role sits within our Customer Acquisition area, where you'll own critical product initiatives including intelligent recommendation systems, dynamic pricing optimization, and market expansion capabilities. Working in an agile environment with cross-functional teams and C-level stakeholders, you'll help shape how Aira scales across diverse European markets while navigating complex technical and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Own the product vision and roadmap for our customer solution matching platform, enabling market teams with pricing capabilities and driving company bets on new products through intelligent recommendation systems
* Lead cross-functional agile team to deliver high-impact features, managing stakeholder relationships across engineering, design, operations, and executive teams
* Establish OKRs and success metrics, develop pricing and recommendation algorithms, and lead A/B testing initiatives to drive continuous improvement
* Drive product initiatives for new geographic markets, adapting to local regulations and consumer behaviors while balancing competing priorities in a fast-paced environment


 We're transforming how clean energy solutions are discovered and delivered across Europe—making complex decisions simple for customers while optimizing business outcomes. If you're motivated by solving challenging product problems in a mission-driven, high-growth environment, this role offers exceptional impact and visibility.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* 5+ years of product management experience with a proven track record of shipping successful products
* Strong background in agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and modern product development practices. Experience facilitating workshops, sprint ceremonies, and cross-functional collaboration
* Experience with product discovery techniques, user research, and data-driven decision making
* Proven ability to manage complex stakeholder relationships and drive consensus across teams
* Comfortable working with engineering teams on technical product requirements
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


**Bonus Experience** 
 (any combination of these is valuable):
   

  

  

* High-growth, scaling environments with rapid market expansion
* International product experience, particularly in European markets


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Front-End Developer
description:
By Marcus Bengtsson
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 Start-up culture. We are a small and highly motivated product driven company. Your contribution will have a direct impact on the product and the success of Checkin.com
   

  

* Become a key part of a great team of skilled experts, all sitting remote but working closely together
* A career opportunity. Join the core team during the beginning of our journey and grow your responsibilities as Checkin.com grows
* Flexibility of working from home with potential option to relocate to Sweden in the future
* A competitive salary with opportunities for fast promotion
* Long term employment with great benefits such as 6 weeks paid vacation


 You will
   

  

* Create world class UI solutions and outstanding web development work
* Be one of the drivers in the development team, taking and solving complex problems together with the others
* Constantly learn, share and develop your skill set


 You have
   

  

* As much passion as we for Javascript and Vue
* A keen eye for UI details, animations and user interaction
* An ability to take ownership and create quality code solutions independently
* Documented experience of Javascript, HTML and CSS projects
* An eye for code quality with experience in unit, integration and E2E-tests
* Good communication skills (oral and written) in English


 It would be nice if you also have
   

  

* Experience in advanced Git strategies
* Experience with Travis CI and AWS deployments
* Worked on Node.js server-side development
* Webview or experience with other mobile app frameworks
* Worked with performance, loading and responsiveness in web pages


 Our current stack
   

  

 Although We Constantly Update It And Have Many Different Types Of Backends And Frontends, We Also Acknowledge That Sometimes a Lot Of Technical Words Can Make It Easier To Understand The Work. For Us The Front-end Makes Up Most Of The Product. This List Is The FE, BE And Collaboration With The Note-worthy Just Bunched Together
   

  

* AWS Cloudfront, AWS Lambda, S3, Travis-CI, Sentry, Vue 2, Vuex, Single page components, Sass, i18next, Babel, Webpack, Nightwatchjs, karma, jest, and more.
* AWS ELB, AWS DB, Node 8, Travis-Ci, Feathersjs 3, jwt, REST, SMS, payment integrations, jest and more
* Slack, Hangouts, VSCode, Github Organizations, Google (Office)


 Interested?
   

  

 Send an email to join@checkin.com explaining why you would be a good fit to the team and we will review and get back to setup a short video call to get to know you a bit better

title: Senior Product Manager – ESG Solutions (Nordics)
description:
At Infor, we build industry-specific cloud solutions that empower businesses to run smarter and more sustainably. With ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) regulations reshaping how companies operate and report, we are expanding our product team to deliver innovative capabilities that help our customers meet these challenges head-on.
   

  

 We are now seeking a Senior Product Manager with expertise in ESG, sustainability reporting, and enterprise applications to join our dynamic team.
   

  

 A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
   

  

 · Drive the product strategy and roadmap for Infor’s ESG and sustainability solutions, with a focus on integration into ERP, supply chain, and financial applications.
   

  

 · Partner with engineering, UX, and industry strategy teams to deliver features that support compliance with CSRD, ESRS, CSDDD, and related global ESG regulations.
   

  

 · Collaborate with customers, industry experts, and regulatory bodies to anticipate market needs and translate them into clear product requirements.
   

  

 · Ensure seamless ESG data collection, analytics, and reporting capabilities across Infor CloudSuites.
   

  

 · Define and track key success metrics to measure product adoption and impact.
   

  

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 · Proven experience (5-10 years) in product management within enterprise software, ERP, supply chain, or sustainability solutions.
   

  

 · Strong understanding of ESG frameworks and regulations (CSRD, ESRS, SFDR, EU Taxonomy, etc.).
   

  

 · Demonstrated ability to translate complex regulatory and market requirements into practical software capabilities.
   

  

 · Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to work across global, cross-functional teams.
   

  

 · Strategic thinker with a passion for driving innovation in sustainability and compliance.
   

  

 · Good presentation skills
   

  

 Why join Infor:
   

  

 · Be a global leader in industry-specific cloud software.
   

  

 · Shape solutions that directly help companies meet their ESG goals and regulatory obligations.
   

  

 · Collaborate with passionate teams at the intersection of technology, compliance, and sustainability.
   

  

 · Competitive compensation and benefits.
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

 For more information visit www.infor.com
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.
   

  

 At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
   

 2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us - and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a Fullstack Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the Growth / Monetization product team. Your role will be to experiment, design, and collaborate on building software systems and features that directly drive and optimize revenue strategies, having a direct and measurable impact on the company's financial success and user experience.
 



 The Growth / Monetization product team is focused on driving revenue growth by optimizing the company's pricing, packaging, product, and feature launches. Its core mission is to develop and implement user-centered approaches that maximize revenue potential while maintaining an excellent user experience.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Influence how the team collaborates, ships code, and engages with stakeholders and dependencies, setting the foundation for our success.
* Be part of setting team-specific engineering standards, processes, and best practices from the start.
* Tackle fresh problems in a rapidly growing area, making a real impact on key business metrics like Conversion and MRR.
* Work closely with product managers, data analysts, designers, and marketing to ship high-impact changes.
* Your work will touch critical revenue-generating areas such as pricing, plans, international launches, upgrading and upselling paths.



  





**Requirements** 



* 4+ years of experience with React, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and IMS.
* 4+ years of experience with Python and/or GoLang.
* Proven experience with experimentation (A/B testing) and working with metrics to drive decisions.
* Adaptable: able to constantly learn from data, challenge the views we hold, and adjust to changing priorities and roadmaps.
* Collaborative: strong team member able to effectively work across functions, disciplines, teams, and product areas.
* Passionate about identifying challenges and building user-centric, revenue-generating solutions.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience with Next.js.
* Experience working with monetization and data-driven decision-making.



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: Data Engineer
description:
Senior Data Engineer / Data Architect – Konsultuppdrag
  
Vi söker dig som är en senior Data Engineer / Data Architect med lång erfarenhet av att bygga, designa och leda arbete kring moderna dataplattformar. Våra kunder finns inom olika branscher och befinner sig ofta i en fas där de vill:
  
Utvärdera och förbättra nuvarande datalösningar (”health check”)
  
Designa en framtidssäker arkitektur för data pipelines och BI-leveranser
  
Bygga och automatisera robusta dataflöden för analys och beslutsstöd
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
Leda och genomföra workshops för att kartlägga nuläge och behov
  
Ta fram arkitektur och design av data pipelines och datamodeller
  
Bygga och automatisera ETL/ELT-processer i moderna molnmiljöer (t.ex. Google Cloud, Azure)
  
**Säkra leverans via API:** er, databaser och analysplattformar
  
Etablera CI/CD och versionshantering för dataflöden
  
Övervaka och kvalitetssäkra driften (larm, stabilitet, säkerhet)
  
Samarbete med dataanalytiker, BI-specialister och andra intressenter
  
Fungera som teknisk lead och bidra till roadmap, planering och prioriteringar
  
  

Kravprofil
  
7–10+ års erfarenhet som Data Engineer/Data Architect i produktion
  
Djup kunskap i Python för dataflöden och orkestrering (Prefect, Airflow eller motsvarande)
  
Expertkunskaper i SQL och datamodellering (PostgreSQL, BigQuery eller motsvarande)
  
Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (Google Cloud, Azure eller AWS)
  
Erfarenhet av API-integration och distributionsmönster
  
Van vid att leda leveranser och samarbeta i agila team
  
  

Meriterande
  
Erfarenhet av DBT, Databricks eller Azure DevOps
  
Erfarenhet av BI-verktyg som Tableau eller Power BI
  
Djupare kompetens inom Google Cloud/BigQuery-ekosystemet
  
  

Vem är du?
  
Vi tror att du är självständig, lösningsorienterad och trygg i en ledande roll. Du gillar att både ta fram strategi och att arbeta praktiskt med att bygga pipelines. Du har lätt att kommunicera med olika intressenter – från utvecklare till affärssidan – och du brinner för att skapa robusta och framtidssäkra dataplattformar.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Är du intresserad av att arbeta som konsult hos oss? Skicka gärna in din ansökan! Observera att vi tyvärr inte tar emot underkonsulter.
  
  

Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
